PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

This PR looks very nice! Why was it abandoned?
Seems that the best approach is record what was added/modified and start over. There are too many conflicts.

> Seems that the best approach is record what was added/modified and start over. There are too many conflicts.

Probably; there aren't a lot of changes.

|Current number|Change|Type|
|-:|:-:|:-|
|5022|-1|porting notes|

Current commit [d6a3d89bee](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/d6a3d89bee530d824900197dd60dc85e43789c46)
Reference commit [ba7312b5aa](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/ba7312b5aafeb13465bb9283536208f2158e6150)

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

bors d+

Thanks :tada: 

If CI passes, please remove the label `awaiting-CI` and merge this yourself, by adding a comment `bors r+`.

bors d+
Maybe switch the factors in `a * p.leadingCoeff ^ (p.natDegree - 1 - i)` in the definition to make this hold without commutativity?
It also needs to be switched in the definition of `scaleRoots`.
I see, thanks for checking! Let's not worry about it.
But the proof should be one line given `integralNormalization_mul_C_leadingCoeff` ...
Splitting of this file (#19370) was just merged into master, so you need to merge master again ...
And which introduce big changes.
What do you mean by big changes?
Oh, I mean that file is split into several files, so the newly added results in `Algebraic` need to find suitable places. But since now the merge conflict is resolved, so I think this is done.
Yeah, results in my algebraicClosure branch may need to go into multiple files. But in this PR only one lemma is changed in the Algebraic file.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: remove `normalizeScaleRoots`
